data.current_summary: Retrieve a specific transactional template version.
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific version of a template.**
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific template version by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific version of a transactional template using the template ID and version ID. Returns the complete template version object including content, metadata, editor type, and generation information. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Added clarity about required parameters (template_id, version_id), what is returned (template version object with specific fields), and authentication requirement. This helps AI agents understand exactly what data is needed and what will be provided.

message: Operation 'UpdateTemplateVersion' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks detail about what can be edited, whether updates are partial or full, what is returned, and side effects. Enhanced version clarifies PATCH semantics (partial updates), specifies editable fields, explains that other versions are unaffected, and includes authentication requirement. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's scope and limitations.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to edit the content of your template version.**
data.summary_suggestion: Update template version content and settings
data.description_suggestion: Updates the content and settings of a specific template version using PATCH semantics. Accepts partial updates to template version properties such as subject, HTML content, plain text content, and metadata. Returns the updated template version object. Does not affect other versions or the active version status unless explicitly modified. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks detail about what can be edited, whether updates are partial or full, what is returned, and side effects. Enhanced version clarifies PATCH semantics (partial updates), specifies editable fields, explains that other versions are unaffected, and includes authentication requirement. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's scope and limitations.

message: Operation 'DeleteTemplateVersion' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, missing_context. Original description is minimal and lacks critical information about permanence, side effects, and response format. Enhanced version clarifies that deletion is permanent, explains the consequence if the active version is deleted, specifies the response code, and includes authentication requirement. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature of the operation and its implications.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a transactional template version.**
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a specific template version from the system. The version cannot be recovered after deletion. If the deleted version is currently active, the template will have no active version until another version is activated. Requires authentication via API key. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Original description is minimal and lacks critical information about permanence, side effects, and response format. Enhanced version clarifies that deletion is permanent, explains the consequence if the active version is deleted, specifies the response code, and includes authentication requirement. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature of the operation and its implications.

message: Operation 'ActivateTemplateVersion' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, missing_context. Original description lacks detail about the operation's effects and constraints. Enhanced version clarifies that only one version can be active, explains the state change (previous version becomes inactive), specifies that this affects future sends, and indicates what is returned. This helps AI agents understand the operation's impact on template behavior and the mutual exclusivity of active versions.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to activate a version of one of your templates.**
data.summary_suggestion: Set a template version as the active version
data.description_suggestion: Activates a specific template version, making it the active version for the template. Only one version can be active at a time. When a new version is activated, the previously active version becomes inactive. All future email sends using this template ID will use the newly activated version. Requires authentication via API key. Returns the updated template version object with active status confirmed.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks detail about the operation's effects and constraints. Enhanced version clarifies that only one version can be active, explains the state change (previous version becomes inactive), specifies that this affects future sends, and indicates what is returned. This helps AI agents understand the operation's impact on template behavior and the mutual exclusivity of active versions.

message: Operation 'CreateTemplate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is too minimal and lacks critical details about inputs (template name requirement), outputs (template ID), and constraints (300 template limit). Added context about template ID usage and account limits to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create a transactional template.**
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new transactional template for your account. Requires a template name in the request body. Returns the created template object with a unique template ID that can be used to reference this template in SendGrid's Mail Send API. The template will be available for creating versions immediately after creation. Each account can create up to 300 templates.
data.reasoning: Description is too minimal and lacks critical details about inputs (template name requirement), outputs (template ID), and constraints (300 template limit). Added context about template ID usage and account limits to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'ListTemplate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description doesn't explain pagination support or filtering capabilities mentioned in parameters. Missing details about what template metadata is returned and account-specific scope. Enhanced to clarify pagination, filtering, return structure, and account isolation for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all transactional templates.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all transactional templates for your account. Supports filtering and pagination parameters to control the results returned. Returns an array of template objects with metadata including template ID, name, creation date, and version information. Templates are account-specific and will not include templates from parent accounts or other subusers.
data.reasoning: Original description doesn't explain pagination support or filtering capabilities mentioned in parameters. Missing details about what template metadata is returned and account-specific scope. Enhanced to clarify pagination, filtering, return structure, and account isolation for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'DuplicateTemplate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks specifics about what gets duplicated (metadata and versions), what the new template ID is, and how the name is handled. Missing input requirements and output details. data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to duplicate a transactional template.**
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of an existing transactional template by duplicating its metadata and all associated versions. Requires the source template ID as a path parameter. Returns the newly created template object with a new unique template ID. The duplicated template will have the same name as the original with a copy indicator, and all versions from the source template will be copied to the new template.
data.reasoning: Description lacks specifics about what gets duplicated (metadata and versions), what the new template ID is, and how the name is handled. Missing input requirements and output details. Added clarity about duplication scope and naming convention to help AI agents understand the operation's full effect.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single transactional template.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the details of a specific transactional template by its template ID. Returns the template object including name, creation date, modification date, and a list of all associated versions with their metadata. Use this operation to inspect template configuration before creating new versions or to verify template details.
data.reasoning: Description is minimal and doesn't specify what information is returned about the template or its versions. Added details about returned fields and use cases to improve AI agent understanding of when to use this operation and what data it provides.

message: Operation 'UpdateTemplate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current summary says 'Edit' which is vague about what can be edited. Description correctly notes that only the name can be edited, but lacks input/output details and could be clearer about the distinction between template metadata and content. Improved summary to be more specific, and enhanced description with input requirements, return value, and clearer guidance on when to use version creation instead.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to edit the name of a transactional template.**

To edit the template itself, [create a new transactional template version](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/transactional-templates-versions/create-a-new-transactional-template-version).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name of an existing transactional template. Requires the template ID as a path parameter and the new template name in the request body. Returns the updated template object with the new name. Note: To modify template content (subject, HTML, or plain text), create a new template version instead using the Create Template Version endpoint. This operation only affects the template metadata, not its versions.
data.reasoning: Current summary says 'Edit' which is vague about what can be edited. Description correctly notes that only the name can be edited, but lacks input/output details and could be clearer about the distinction between template metadata and content. Improved summary to be more specific, and enhanced description with input requirements, return value, and clearer guidance on when to use version creation instead.

message: Operation 'DeleteTemplate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks critical information about side effects (deletion of all versions, inability to undo, impact on Mail Send API). Missing output details (204 response). Added warnings about permanence and impact to help AI agents understand the destructive nature of this operation and make informed decisions.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a transactional template.**
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a transactional template and all of its associated versions. Requires the template ID as a path parameter. This action cannot be undone. After deletion, the template ID cannot be used in Mail Send API requests. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. Ensure no active sending processes depend on this template before deletion.
data.reasoning: Description lacks critical information about side effects (deletion of all versions, inability to undo, impact on Mail Send API). Missing output details (204 response). Added warnings about permanence and impact to help AI agents understand the destructive nature of this operation and make informed decisions.

message: Operation 'CreateTemplateVersion' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is too minimal and doesn't explain what constitutes a version, what inputs are required, or the critical detail that new versions aren't automatically active. Missing output details and the important side effect about activation requirements. data.current_summary: Create a new transactional template version.
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create a new version of a template.**
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new version of an existing transactional template. Requires the template ID as a path parameter and version details (name, subject, HTML content, plain text content, and editor type) in the request body. Returns the created template version object with a unique version ID. The new version will not be automatically set as active; you must explicitly activate it to use it in Mail Send API requests. Multiple versions allow you to maintain different template variations without changing the template ID.
data.reasoning: Description is too minimal and doesn't explain what constitutes a version, what inputs are required, or the critical detail that new versions aren't automatically active. Missing output details and the important side effect about activation requirements. Enhanced to clarify version creation purpose, required inputs, return value, and activation workflow for better AI agent understanding.
